summary: The 8,600 buildings that the General Services Administration owns or leases for federal agencies consume a lot of energy and emit a significant amount of greenhouse gases. In 2021, an executive order set new long-term federal sustainability goals. In response, GSA updated its practices to further promote buildings' energy efficiency and reduce their emissions—but GSA officials said it will be hard to meet these goals...
title: Federal Buildings: Capital Access and Market Options Are Key Challenges Facing GSA's Sustainability Efforts
